meanings.definition: A number that divides another number.
meanings.sent1: In math class, we learned how to find common denominators when adding fractions.
meanings.sent2: The denominator in a fraction tells us how many equal parts the whole is divided into.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous denominator decided to divide the cake into unequal slices just to confuse everyone.
meanings.sent4: The denominator acted like a referee, ensuring each team had an equal share of the playing field.
meanings.sent5: The denominator was like a divider, neatly separating the pizza into equal slices for everyone to enjoy.

meanings.definition: A common trait or characteristic shared by a group.
meanings.sent1: Honesty is a key denominator in building trust among friends.
meanings.sent2: The denominator of hard work brought the team together to achieve their goal.
meanings.sent3: The denominator of laughter made the group bond even stronger.
meanings.sent4: Kindness acted as the common denominator that connected people from different backgrounds.
meanings.sent5: The denominator of perseverance united the team in overcoming challenges together.
